title: Demi Lovato fans come to defense as nude photos are posted online after Snapchat account is hacked
text:
Naked photographs of Demi Lovato were posted to the singer's social media by hackers on Thursday.

The 27-year-old entertainer, according to The Blast, was targeted by hackers who subsequently posted the intimate shots to her Snapchat account.

The hackers also posted a directive to a separate group under the title 'Discord.'

The latest: Naked photographs of Demi Lovato, 27, were posted to the singer's social media by hackers on Thursday. She was snapped last year in Las Vegas

According to the outlet, the group of hackers who targeted the Tell Me You Love Me performer is the same that has claimed credit for similar efforts aimed at actress Chloe Grace Moretz, as well as a hacking of the Twitter page of the company's CEO, Jack Dorsey.

Lovato's publicity team had the nude photos taken down, the outlet reported.

An intimate hacked photo of the Sorry Not Sorry songstress surfaced online in March of 2017, but Lovato brushed it off, citing an makeup-free, nude pictorial she did for Vanity Fair in October of 2015.

'I love how everyone’s freaking out about one picture,' Lovato wrote. 'It’s not nude and it’s just cleavage. Besides the world has seen me nude BY CHOICE before..'

Details: The hackers also posted a directive to a separate group under the title 'Discord'

International star: Demi was snapped in Stockholm, Sweden performing last year

Shake it off: An intimate photo of the Sorry Not Sorry songstress surfaced online in March of 2017, but Lovato brushed it off, citing an makeup-free, nude pictorial she did for Vanity Fair in October of 2015

The Confident artist's fans rallied behind her amid the online incident, which comes more than five years after a number of Hollywood stars - including Jennifer Lawrence and Kate Upton - had their nude photos surface online amid a series of iCloud hacks.

'This is the demi lovato y'all should be sharing,' one user wrote, with a shot of Lovato singing onstage. 'A powerhouse vocalist and that no one can take away from her.'

Another said, 'What we are NOT going to do is body shame Demi Lovato,' citing the singer's candor about her past eating disorder.

'Struggling with an eating disorder is hard enough already without y’all making comments about her own private pictures that some group of disgusting individuals hacked into,' the user wrote. 'Grow up & get a damn hobby other than being trolls.'
description: An imitate photo of the Sorry Not Sorry songstress surfaced online in March of 2017, but Lovato brushed it off, citing an makeup-free, nude pictorial she did for Vanity Fair in October of 2015.
